People with Potocki-Shaffer syndrome also have enlarged openings in the two bones that make up much of the top and sides of the skull (enlarged parietal foramina). These abnormal openings form extra ""soft spots"" on the head, in addition to the two that newborns normally have. Unlike the usual newborn soft spots, the enlarged parie
